Package Controller

Class AppointmentsController

java.lang.Object
Controller.AppointmentsController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentsController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class controls the appointments.FXML GUI. It declares all the GUI objects in the FXML and controls them.
Version:
1.0, September 26th, 2022
Author:
Mike Fasnacht, mfasnac@wgu.edu

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This initializes() method sets the items to be displayed in the appointment Table.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • returnBtn

      public void returnBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The returnBtn() method returns the user to the Directory GUI page. It's tied to the return button within the GUI
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event that triggers this method is when the return button is pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • deleteBtn

      public void deleteBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException, IOException
      The deleteBtn() method deletes the selected appointment. It checks if an appointment is selected and displays an alert if no appointment is selected. it calls a separate method to delete the appointment from the list and from the database, displays a confirmation alert to delete, and if deleted shows a message displaying data of the deleted appointment, and confirming its deletion.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - this event triggers when the delete button is pressed.
      Throws:
      SQLException
      IOException

    • createBtn

      public void createBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The createBtn() method takes the user to the CreateAppointment GUI. The method sets a boolean for tracking update/create status to false, and initializes the create appointment page.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This event trigger when the create button is pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • updateBtn

      public void updateBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The updateBtn() method takes you to the Create Appointment GUI. The method checks to see if an appointment is selected and displays an alert if not. If so it sets the boolean for tracking appointment update/creation status to true, assigns a pointer to the selected object and initializes the GUI for Updating appointments.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This even triggers when the update button is pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setAppointmentView

      public void setAppointmentView()
      This method initializes the appointment Lists for weekly and Monthly view. It goes through all appointments and adds any that are within the next 7 days to the weekly list, and any that are within the same month and year as now(). This method is called when the Appointments GUI is initialized.

    • allOnAction

      public void allOnAction(javafx.event.Event event)
      This method filters the tableview to show all Appointments.

    • weeklyOnAction

      public void weeklyOnAction(javafx.event.Event event)
      This method filters the tableview to show only appointments within the next 7 days.

    • monthlyOnAction

      public void monthlyOnAction(javafx.event.Event event)
      This method filters the tableview to show only appointments within the current month.

    • resetListView

      public void resetListView()
      This method resets the table view depending on the currently selected tab in the GUI.
